page.title: 14NEWMAN'S SHOP, WARBOYS
page.content: The oldest shop in Warboys is called NEWMAN'S. It is over 100 years old and it has been kept in its original state. On the shelves there are 20 old tea tins with Chinese paintings on. They have kept the old drawers which were used for dried goods such as dates, dried peas and currants. The oak counter is the original and on the counter there still stands the original oil lamp. The shop is now owned by Mrs. Newman who has owned it for 26 years. There is a full-time assistant who still does deliveries on his bicycle. The shop sells lots of things as well as food, including clothes and shoes. During the war the cellar was used as an air raid shelter but now it floods and has to be pumped out whenever it rains and so it is kept empty.
